gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: The 1000-meter U.S. National Grid (1000 m x 1000 m) for Indiana: Indiana, 2012

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University
Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University (Data provider)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This data set shows the Indiana-portion of the 1000-meter United States National Grid (USNG). The following is excerpted from metadata provided with the original source data set named IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP: This is a polygon feature data layer of United States National Grid (1000 m x 1000 m polygons) constructed by the Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies at Delta State University with support from the US Geological Survey under the Cooperative Agreement 07ERAG0083. For correct display, please set the base coordinate system and projection such that it matches the UTM zone for which these data were constructed using the NAD 83 datum. Further information about the US National Grid is available from http://www.fgdc.gov/usng and a viewing of these layers as applied to local geography may be seen at the National Map, http://www.nationalmap.gov .

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The United States National Grid (USNG) establishes a nationally consistent grid reference system (or "language of location"), and is intended to support emergency response, the general public, and commercial activities. It provides a grid reference system that is seemless across jurisdictional boundaries and is the foundation for a universal base map index. Using the USNG provides an unambiguous way to describe locations where users are operating in areas away from established road networks, or in areas affected by natural disasters where roads and/or road signs have been destroyed. The following is excerpted from metadata provided with the original source data set named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP": "The purpose of this data layer is to enable and promote the use of US National Grid as an 'attributed polygon overlay' over other feature data layers in paper and digital maps."

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University, Cleveland Mississippi 38733

These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the- ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana. The following is excerpted from metadata provided with the original source dataset named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP": "This data set should not be used for commercial purposes. It can be freely used for public good by academic and for emergency/disaster response. Please contact the Delta State GIS Center at 662 846 4522 for clarification."

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise, Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.0 (Build 3200, Service Pack 2), Approximately 27.1 Mb

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: There was no information provided in the metadata that accompanied the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" pertaining to logical consistancy, but is assumed to be topologically correct.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: There was no information provided in the metadata that accompanied the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" pertaining to logical consistancy, but is assumed to be topologically correct.
There was no information provided in the metadata that accompanied the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" pertaining to completeness, but is assumed to be complete.
There was no information provided in the metadata that accompanied the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" pertaining to attribute accuracy. All attributes are assumed to be correct.
Accuracy is no better than that of the source shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP".
Vertical accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of the data set.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: An ESRI shapefile named "IN_USNG_UTM16.SHP" was downloaded by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) on November 8, 2012, from the following Web site: http://mississippi.deltastate.edu/ . The shapefile was opened in ESRI ArcGIS 10.0 for visual inspection and to validate the projected coordinate system of UTM Zone 16, NAD 1983. It was then renamed as "NATIONAL_GRID_1000M_IN.SHP" to conform to internal naming conventions of the IGS.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
The Indiana portion of the U.S. National Grid (USNG), a 1000-meter locational reference grid

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University
Center for Interdisciplinary Geospatial Information Technologies, Delta State University

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.
